subject: Real Estate
title: 1031 Exchange: The Tax Deferral Loophole
description: A short lesson to help you apply 1031 Exchange: The Tax Deferral Loophole.

hook.text: Sell an investment property and you owe capital gains tax â€” unless you roll the money into a new one.

buildup.text: Section 1031 of the U.S. tax code lets investors defer taxes by swapping one property for another.

discovery.text: There's no limit to how many times you can exchange. Some investors defer taxes for their entire lives.

twist.text: When the owner dies, heirs receive a 'stepped-up basis' â€” the deferred tax is erased completely.

climax.text: Critics call it a wealth-building loophole. Supporters say it keeps capital flowing into real estate.

punchline.text: Swap, defer, die, and the tax vanishes.

quiz.question: What does a 1031 exchange allow investors to do?
options: Defer capital gains tax by reinvesting in property
